main event: On 12 February 1956 in Aripeka, Florida, a civilian spotted a round object with red and yellow rotating lights, which appeared to land or pass over the horizon. The observation lasted for approximately 10 minutes and was made using binoculars.
interesting points: The object was described as a round tire or hubcap with red and yellow rotating lights.
It was observed through binoculars and seemed to land or move beyond the horizon.
The sighting was in the vicinity of a B-47 and a KC-97, but the report concluded that the observer probably saw one of these aircraft.
There was no photographic evidence of the sighting, and the source of the report was a civilian at the GOC post.
The conclusion of the report stated that the object was probably either an aircraft or a weather balloon, with no definitive explanation.
sighted object: round object with red and yellow rotating lights
